description: If you want to look younger, your focus should be on nourishing foods, anti-aging supplements, certain nourishing face creams and minor lifestyle changes.
cleaned_text: How to look younger is the question we all want answered at some point in our lives. Sadly, today there is no miracle cure or one pill to take those years away instantly. However, health and beauty both start from the inside, and there is a lot you can do about it yourself each day. Because just like any other tissue in your body, your skin has a vital tasks to fill and it requires specific nutrients and certain lifestyle to stay healthy and function properly. Nutrient deficiencies, junk food, toxification and dehydration can quickly change the view of your skin and make it look tired, dry, full of wrinkles or hyperpigmented. Thus, if you want to look younger and keep your skin smooth and glowing, your focus shouldn't be on makeup to cover the imperfections, but on nourishing foods, anti-aging food supplements, certain nourishing face creams and minor lifestyle changes as all these play the key role in a healthy and youthful look. Given below are 9 simple beauty tips and [14 beauty supplements]that can improve skin health and help you look and feel younger for longer. How to Look Younger Naturally - 9 Simple Tips 1. Walk at Least 15 Minutes Each Day to Look Younger Because walking is such a common activity for us, its effects on various aspects of human health have been thoroughly studied. Based on the results of a 12-year study, a daily 15-minute walk reduced mortality by as much as 22%. This percentage was even higher for longer and more active workouts. Though, some do not see walking as an "aerobic" workout and ignore the benefits of walking. However, aerobic exercise can be defined as an exercise that stimulates the heart and respiratory tract to pump more oxygen into the muscles. Even slow walking does all this. But the faster you walk, the higher the aerobic activity. The Sleep Research Foundation published a study that found that vigorous, moderate-intensity aerobic exercise (such as walking) reduced time spent sleeping and increased sleep length among people with chronic insomnia compared to nights where they did not exercise during the day. Their advice is to do at least 30 minutes of physical activity a day. Or a total of at least 150 minutes of moderate or 75 minutes of intense exercise per week in order for the protective properties of the body to be affected. The recommended time (walking is the easiest) does not have to be done all at once. If you cannot walk 30-minutes, walk two times a day for 15 minutes, it is just as good. Not everyone can work out in the gym or run 10 floors down the stairs, but most of us can walk. With all these benefits mentioned below, one small walk a day is worth it. You can start gradually and progress according to your endurance and the right pace. All you need is a decent pair of shoes and 15 minutes a day! Benefits of walking: - Increased cardiovascular, respiratory and circulatory activity means that nutrients go where they need to go to support training. - Instead of storing energy, it is used and the organs, muscles and bones become stronger. Our bodies are designed to move! - Without the slightest doubt, a sedentary lifestyle that does not allow the body to exercise enough leads to disease. Sedentary lifestyle is a very real situation, which is considered to be one of the most important public health problems in society, as it causes many chronic diseases and millions of premature deaths a year. - You will lose it, if you don't use it - and it's about everything from muscle strength to cognition. - Walking outdoors also has a supportive effect on mental health. The natural environment (away from electronics and other distractions) improves mood, lowers stress and reduces [depression](https://ecosh.com/depression-symptoms-warning-signs-and-natural-treatment/). - The sun feeds us with important [vitamin D](https://ecosh.com/top-11-foods-highest-in-vitamin-d/), the lack of which in the human body has already become epidemic in the industrial world. But walking indoors is almost as good. - Each body's workout, including walking, reduces the risk of injury, improves mobility, increases blood and nutrient supply, thereby strengthening bones and connective tissue. - The American Heart Association recommends walking to reduce the risk of hypertension, [high cholesterol](https://ecosh.com/cholesterol-hdl-and-ldl-how-to-lower-your-bad-cholesterol-naturally/), stroke and [diabetes.](https://ecosh.com/blood-sugar-diabetes-hypoglycemia/) - A meta-analysis of walking studies lasting an average of 11 years in seven different countries found that regular walking reduced the incidence of cardiovascular disease by 31% and reduced the risk of mortality by 32%. 2. Drink Enough Water A person consists of 60-70% water. Water is one of the most important substances that absolutely every part of the body and cell needs. Without water your body cannot function. Even better if you could drink mineral or mineralized water. Read more about [The Health Benefits of Drinking Mineralized Water]. According to National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine the average, healthy adult living in a temperate climate sufficient daily fluid intake is: - Men - About 15.5 cups (3.7 liters) of fluids a day - Women - About 11.5 cups (2.7 liters) of fluids a day These recommendations cover all fluids - water, other beverages and food. About 20% of daily fluid consumption usually comes from food and the rest from drinks. You've probably also heard the 8 x 8 rule, which means you should drink eight 8-ounce (about 240 ml) glasses of water a day. However the need for water depends on several things like for example your age, weight and health condition as pregnant and breastfeeding mothers need more water. In addition, according to [Healthline], the water needed for pregnant women is 10 cups (80 ounces) a day, while breastfeeding women need 13 (104 ounces) cups of water a day. 8.
